name: market for geothermal power plant, Hot-Dry-Rock | geothermal power plant, Hot-Dry-Rock | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/1041/documentation

This is a market activity. In the case of services or immobile infrastructures, markets are connecting suppliers and consumers at a global level. For specific connections at regional level, direct links between the local producing activities and the local consumers are preferred. Transport or losses are logically not relevant for this type of products.;This is the market for  'geothermal power plant, Hot-Dry-Rock', in the Global geography.;This market contains no transport or losses, as they are irrelevant for the delivered product.;This is an immobile infrastructure, representing the construction of a geothermal power plant, Hot-Dry-Rock. The system is also known as Enhanced geothermal systems (EGS) and it is used to explote Earthâ€™s interior heat outside known geothermal provinces. The infrastructure represents a plant with three deep boreholes with depths between 5,000 m and 6,000 m that has a flow rate of 224 m3/h, a land area of 7,500m2 and a lifetime of 20 years. The process includes all materials necessary to construct it, infrastructure and energy used in the machinery during the construction.

This activity starts with the built infrastructure ready to use.

This activity ends with the infrastructure made accessible to the users. Transport or losses are considered irrelevant for this product.
